title: Outstanding Practice
body:
From arriving at the hospital early morning to be admitted for a hip replacement, right through to being discharged the next day, the whole team were amazing. 
At each touch point the staff were outstanding and made what was a very anxious, emotional experience bearable. 
There are not the words to praise each member of the team enough. 
Absolutely Outstanding.
P S. The food Is delicious too.
Thank you Barlborough Hospital Team. You re amazing.

author: Grateful69
title: Excellent care
body: I recently attended the Endoscopy unit for a colonoscopy and I was very impressed by the excellent care I received. Staff Nurse Wendy who attended to me was so lovely and gentle in her approach. I was taken through for my procedure by Eva and herself and Donna were there throughout and they were both lovely. Mr Evgenikos carried out the procedure and was also so lovely. Every member of staff was professional and they are all a credit to the NHS. Thankyou to you all.

readBy.name: Office of Annabelle Ewing, MSP for Cowdenbeath

author: Tired and confused
title: Inpatient at North Devon District Hospital
body:
I had to wait hours at times in pain because there weren‚Äôt enough nurses on shift to cover all their tasks. It was very difficult to get any sleep because it was so noisy. Machines were left beeping unnecessarily because nurses were unavailable to turn them off. I was told countless times that I‚Äôd get an update later in the day from a doctor. When I asked a nurse later why I hadn‚Äôt seen the doctor I was told they were too busy. The two weekends I was in led to inaction due to the specialist doctors I needed to see not working. I was confidently given information by other doctors which contradicted information I had already received. I was later told by specialists that the general doctors who had advised me at the weekends were wrong. One doctor tried to discharge me home on a Saturday which I had to be very assertive about to prevent what I was later told would have been a very dangerous discharge.  
The person next to me with advance dementia was who was objecting to treatment was told by the nurse he had an MCA so they were acting in his best interest. It beggars belief that if this person lacks capacity they he would understand what that meant. We were frequently kept awake by staff talking loudly and laughing overnight, banging things around and seemingly having no regard for the need for sleep.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Ayrshire Resident2
title: Disjointed care with no follow up - cardiac care
body:
I was diagnosed in February this year with Atrial Fibrillation and the GP referred me to see a cardiologist. My condition worsened and I was admitted to hospital as an emergency before my appointment with a cardiologist.  
I was in hospital for 6 days, and was treated very well, as they increased my medication to try and control my heart rhythm. I was then given an Echo Cardiogram and released the same day.  
I spoke to a doctor before my release who explained that my AF would be controlled by medication and I would be discharged to the care of the heart failure liaison nurse in the community who would adjust my medication as required. This was also repeated in my discharge letter.  
This never happened and I have spent the last 6 months trying to find out who should be monitoring my medication and condition.  
I can provide details of the contact I have had with the consultant‚Äôs secretary, GP Practice and heart failure liaison nurse.  
I don‚Äôt raise this issue with you lightly as I am aware of the pressure the NHS has been under during the pandemic, but I feel the follow up care I have received falls below an acceptable standard and should be evaluated to see if there are improvements to be made. I feel I have fallen through cracks in the system and have been left in limbo.

readBy.name: South Ayrshire Health and Social Care Partnership
Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: GKT123
title: Lack of Communication
body:
I was in a lot of pain due to a medical condition. Upon speaking to a nurse at my GP's, they notified me that if they printed my prescription I would be able to pick it up from the practice rather than wait for it to be sent to the pharmacy as it would take longer.  
As I was in pain I said that would be great and so made my way to pick it up. I‚Äôm aware of covid restrictions and that the GP Practice has to take the safety of everyone seriously, however when I arrived I was spoken to in a rude manner and told I should not have just ‚Äòturned up‚Äô and that all prescriptions should be picked up from the pharmacy. The way in which I was spoken to really upset me and even when the nurse explained the situation to the receptionist I wasn‚Äôt offered an apology.  
The prescription wasn‚Äôt ready and so I was told to come back and so later I made my way back to the doctors. A different receptionist was now on and clearly there had been no communication between them as once again I was spoken to in a rude manner despite my prescription ready and waiting next to them. Again, no apology was offered when they realised and so I went home and cried. The last thing anyone needs when they‚Äôre in pain is to be spoken to like that twice despite being told to attend the surgery by a member of staff in the first place. I‚Äôm understanding of the current covid situation and the stress that everyone is currently experiencing. However, kindness goes a long way especially when communicating with unwell patients.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: mineralmh88
title: My 91 year old mother was admitted to hospital
body: There was no visiting allowed and my mother was not able to operate a mobile phone so we had no contact with her. It was difficult to get through to the ward so I felt anxious and frustrated at not knowing how things were. The Virtual visit facility was a God Send to both me and my mother.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: bravodf76
title: Basal cell carcinoma
body: My GP diagnosed my basal cell carcinoma and referred me to RCH where I received an appointment to assess my condition. I was quickly given a date for the procedure to be performed, and on the day of my procedure I was treated with the utmost respect and such kindness and skill. I was informed at every stage what was happening and there was humour too which kept things light hearted and made me feel very relaxed. Mr Adcock the consultant and the nursing staff Hilary and Terry were just so wonderful and I can‚Äôt thank them enough, they made a procedure I was dreading and not just a little bit afraid of, into an almost fun occasion. Saying thank you to them as I left felt totally insufficient for the treatment and care I had received, so I would like to say again thank you most sincerely.

author: antliaqw97
title: the care I received at Amersham Hospital
body:
The NHS gets a lot of complaints, however I have been on the receiving end of  
kindness and concern at Amersham hospital, where I have been attending for  
my leg ulcers.  
There is a calm atmosphere there, which I find especially helpful, I am wheelchair  
bound, and it often takes me more time to do certain things, but there I am never rushed, or feel pressured. All the personnel there were so helpful, the porters even came out to the carpark to get my wheelchair out of the car, and to lift it back into the car when I had finished.. I have attended this hospital on several occasions and find it the same each time I attend.  
WELL DONE AMERSHAM

author: Lady Sempill
title: Endoscopy Service Queen Margaret Hospital. Dunfirmline NHS Fife
body:
Colonoscopy with sedation.  
Throughput my visit the staff were kind, informative and professional.  
The procedure was clearly explained during the process and was not uncomfortable.  
The sedation in this case was very efficient.  
The findings and diagnosis were explained carefully and thoughtfully.  
The recovery was quick and fuss free. The discharge was swift and well organised. My visit lasted just over 2 hours, and during my visit I felt comfortable and well informed at each step.  
I cannot praise the staff of the Endoscopy Unit, the consultant, registrar, and nurses enough, all were excellent.

author: atlasbg93
title: Hysteroscopy
body: I had a hysteroscopy and polypectomy under general anaesthetic at Llandough and the experience was really positive. The staff were brilliant and caring and I made a very quick recovery. Initially I was scheduled to have this procedure done under local anaesthetic but having experienced a very painful biopsy (with no pain relief) which left me fearful, I insisted on having it done under general anaesthetic. Every woman who needs a hysteroscopy should have the opportunity to discuss pain relief options with her consultant and not be steered or pressured towards local anaesthetic as though it were her only choice. Here‚Äôs hoping that an individualised discussion about pain relief for this procedure can become standard, it might save a lot of unecessary distress. Thanks again to the consultant who treated me and all the team at Llandough for your care.

readBy.name: Cardiff and Vale University Health Board

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: I could not be happier with the service
body:
I came in recently to be induced. From the moment I arrived I was greeted with respect and professionalism.  
Following a long wait before being able to head to the delivery suite I was very anxious about what was to come. Midwives Naomi and Niamh made myself and my husband very content by explaining all that would happen. Their duty of care was exceptional and I can never put into words just how thankful I am to them both for helping me through the difficult but worthy labour.  
I would like to give a special mention to the lead midwife, Mary, who attended the birth and provided excellent post-birth care ensuring I would heal well. To the anaesthetist who tried an epidural even though I was too late, I appreciated your patience and understanding.  
Most of all, thank you so so much to the Southern Trust for yet another successful birth. I have high respect for each and every employee within this trust. The hygiene in this hospital has been absolutely amazing and the food has been 100%. I could not be happier with the service that has been provided to me. Thank you so so much.  
In the future, I think a breastfeeding support worker is needed and in this hot weather we should have some fans in this ward.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ana2020
title: My breastfeeding journey at work
body: I am just back to work after maternity leave and having the facilities and support from Ward 16 nurses and my direct team leads is helping me to continue feed my son with breast milk. The team at ward 16 always find a way to accommodate me and to make me feel welcome and at ease. I hope more mums could have the same support at work.   Breastfeeding is a beautiful journey only made possible with the support from others around me.

author: Peterryder
title: The removal of an SCC from the top of my head and after care
body:
The operation was carried out at the West Cornwall Hospital Penzance in July 2021 and was successful in the sense that in a letter dated a month later, the Consultant Dermatologist advised that the SCC had been completely removed and and no further surgery or intervention was required. However I am left with a significant hole in my head. and the wound clearly needs care and that has been provided by a combination of nurses from the Dermatogy Department in the Royal Cornwall Hospital Truro, my practice nurse and my wife.  
Currently the wound dressing consists of a Cosomopore covering and activeheal hydrogel. Initially the practice nurse added an iodine dressing too but this was stopped under direction from a senior nurse from the Dermatology because there was no sign of infection. That remains the case on 23rd August  
My overall impression is of a lack of communication between nurses in the Dermatology Department and the Practice Nurse. My wife is reliant on my description of what the nurses do when they change the dressing. So far so good.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018

title: Best GP practice we have ever had
body: My husband was in the RAF, we have moved house 21 times, so been registered at numerous practices around the country. We moved here to be near our daughter and ended up in widdrington as we found the perfect bungalow. We were delighted to find there was a GP practice in the village that also had a dentist, pharmacy, optician and offered all the other services you could require. We have been very, very impressed with this practice and the care we receive from them. All the staff are friendly and helpful, we always get to see or speak to a doctor when we want to and they always listen and offer appropriate, up to date treatment. We cannot praise this practice enough, the GPS, nurses, receptionists, phlebotomists, pharmacy, dentist and dental nurse are all professional, friendly and helpful. We are so so thankful we chose this village. üëèüëè‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Five star service.

title: Don't listen to the patient
body: I am happy to fill in an eConsult but when I get told off for not answering the phone when I have specifically told them I cannot answer it during working hours because of the nature of my work, I get annoyed. And then to be told if I miss another appointment (telephone one that has no specified time), I will be asked to leave I get frustrated. I appreciate that it is difficult at the moment and that I am inconveniencing the surgery but if I am given a specific call back time, I can arrange leave to take the call like I would a face to face appointment.

title: Caring staff
body:
I first engaged with the service for six weeks of counselling. My therapist quickly put me at ease and was easy to talk to. 

As I was still really struggling I was referred for a short course of CBT. Thereafter I was offered more intensive CBT by video. This therapist was professional, non-judgemental and it felt like they could handle my distress remaining empathic but without any significant reaction. We worked through strategies to manage my symptoms (attention exercises, rumination, activity diaries etc) and they listened at all times despite me going off track and drifting back into wanting to be counselled. The therapy did give me a greater sense of what I can control and a better understanding of my condition (anxiety as opposed to depression - although this is my self-diagnosis as the service is not diagnostic)

My only negative would be to say that 6 weeks is a very short period of time for counselling and I could have done with something more intensive. This is not the fault of the service and is an issuer relating to government funding. The practice did all they could to help and offer additional support, giving me three different courses of therapy as outlined above & I feel in a better position than when I started therapy

readBy.name: South London and Maudsley NHS Foundation Trust

author: Chafs65
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience has been fine
body:
I came in through A&E, nurses were busy non-stop but I didn‚Äôt have to wait long. My experience has been fine, staff are friendly and keep me updated. Doctor sees me daily, I‚Äôm comfortable asking questions but sometimes they can‚Äôt answer them. Nurses get me anything I need and are super helpful. I am on a clean ward. The food is grand. I‚Äôm vegetarian and there is enough on the menu for me which is good.  
One improvement would be to bring cups of tea around more often. We don‚Äôt get any tea in the morning or with lunch or in afternoon unfortunately.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Great receptionist customer service
body: I rang today and spoke with a lady who was polite quickly found the answers to my questions and completed my queries with a very polite voice tone and good listener skills she was clear too thanks very much appreciate the good service

author: Veggydietmatters
title: Food and nutrition
body:
I have a family member who is vegetarian and has been going through aggressive chemotherapy, Over the last 3 months family have had to deliver food daily due to poor options for vegetarian diet on offer. Visiting is prohibited though. This is taking an emotional toll  
On the patient and their family. The patient will likely remain in hospital Many months yet. The vegetarian option offered one day last week was tuna pasta. This is disrespectful and damaging the health of an already weak patient.

title: Really great practice
body: During the whole pandemic situation I have found the telephone triage system to work very well, staff helpful, appointments available, concerns listened to and tests done. I have been very happy with this practice and the staff

author: sunrp74
title: Excellent professional service
body: Excellent professional service in dermatology Dr Narayanan and support via Ms Grace.

author: Eddiepeace
title: My xray
body: I went to Cromer. hospital for a chest xray it was quick and easy very good staff the nurse told me just what to do and said your Doctor will get results in about 7 working days, but when I rang my doctors surgery, I was told it takes four to five weeks before they receive results that seems z very long time when you have been told seven days.

author: Grateful Lee
title: Quality Care
body: Am have COPD and Asthma. In Aug I had an exacerbation requiring a trip to A&E at Basingstoke and Hants Hospital as advised by NHS111. The welcome, treatment and professionalism shown to me made an unpleasant and fearful event manageable so at no time was I concerned over the quality of care and those helping me. From Reception to triage to ED doctors and nurses, everything was done to put me at ease, to treat and arrange follow up and to make all seem unrushed concerned for for my ease and benefit. Please thank those involved as I was not able to say thank you to all, before I left.

author: Connie90
title: My surgery at Craigavon
body:
I recently had surgery to remove a tumour from my neck and I really wanted to thank all the staff involved especially the nurses on ward one west (Elective admission ward) in Craigavon Area Hospital. One nurse assistant, Tracey, was especially helpful! So Thank you Tracey!!  
It was extra difficult with not being able to have any visitors but these nurses spent the time with me on the ward when I just needed someone. It has been a very worrying 4 months for myself and my family but I am on the mend now.  
I was extremely well cared for before and after my surgery and felt very safe even during this pandemic. All precautions were taken to keep us (patients) safe and all staff safe from covid.  
The whole staff in the hospital are working so hard and I just wanted them to know how much I personally appreciate them in their jobs.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: deltarg38
title: Cannot fault attentive and brilliant staff
body:
This is my second visit to Daisy Hill Hospital recently with gall stones. Starting in the Emergency Department, I had a fairly long wait - approximately 7 hours. However, I couldn't fault the attentive and brilliant staff who looked after me during my time in the ED.  
Up on the female surgical ward, my experience has been brilliant. The staff have been absolutely lovely - there really is no other word for them. They are just so very helpful and extremely attentive. I would especially like to mention nurses Jodie, Ursula and Katrina and the countless others involved in my care.  
When it comes to the ward itself - I really could not fault the cleanliness. The staff are absolutely meticulous in keeping the ward in such a great way.  
The only real problem I have encountered during both of my stays is the food. The meals are absolutely atrocious. The quality of the food is alright but the repetitiveness is awful - especially if you are in for over a week. I have had to have food brought into me it has been that bad. Even if just the flavours of soup could be changed each week it would make it slightly better. When you are in hospital, mealtime can be the highlight of your day, which is why I am so disappointed.  
Another small point would be the quality of TV's in the wards. I feel a better quality TV's would be good as currently you can barely see them and the remote controls go missing half of the time. I feel that this would make a good difference to the monotony of the hospital stay.  
A final point which does not affect me directly is the Virtual Visiting Service. I feel that it needs to be highlighted more to patients and their relatives. I have seen the amazing difference it can make to a person in hospital to see a friendly face, especially to those who are more elderly and lack their own access to technology. I feel that this service needs to be advertised more in order to improve the quality of the hospital stay for lots of people as it is clear that many are not aware of the service.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: juliethf57
title: Support from stroke team
body: Margaret (speech therapist) rang me a month ago to talk to me about her session with my uncle. Without that conversation I wouldn't be where I am today - I might have been in a box myself. She helped me see what my responsibilities are and what I can and can't do for my uncle and that was so helpful. Her time in that conversation made such a lot of difference to me and it was amazing listening to her tell me what she saw and realise that she understood. It was really helpful and I am very grateful.

readBy.name: Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists (RCSLT)

author: loubol3
title: Gynaecology visit
body: My teenage daughter attended the hospital for day surgery in April . I was unable to attend with her due to covid restrictions and waited outside the hospital for her to be discharged. We received a follow up appointment for her to attend the gynaecologist department in June. This was later cancelled till September then again cancelled till October. My daughter hasn‚Äôt been seen since her procedure in April. There hasn‚Äôt been a letter of her diagnosis, as I phoned the gynaecologist secretary the following day to ask. Would I receive one and to ask about her stitches as no information was passed on to me about her after care. My daughter was able to tell me what she could remember but this is vague as she was on strong painkillers. The GP called with my daughters histology results at the end of July, that is the only information we have received. I am unhappy with the length of time my daughter has had to wait between procedure and a follow up appointment. My daughter was told she has endometriosis, I feel she would of benefited from a follow up appointment to discuss her diagnosis.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in A&E
body: I came into hospital on Saturday night via A& E. I was taken in by ambulance which thankfully arrived really quickly. I was made comfortable by the 2 members of the ambulance crew as they reassured me which made me feel much happier. When I got into the hospital I was seen straight away in A& E and trusted all the members of medical and nursing staff looking after me. I was kept informed throughout and someone was always there to answer my questions or help me with anything I needed. The staff down in the emergency department, in such a high pressured and stressful job had such a good attitude towards work and it was admirable to observe. I knew I was in safe hands and that they would try their best to help me get better. After this A& E experience I was taken up onto 3 North. The staff up here have been so good and the doctors and nurses have treated me with the upmost dignity and respect. I am comfortable and content with my ward space and am completely satisfied with the standard of care I have received in my staff so far.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: piscesx20
title: COVID-19 vaccine
body: I had the best treatment at my vaccine. Was so looked after by all the staff and volunteers. They handed out water due to it being hot and biscuits whilst I waited post vaccine. Felt very reassured the whole way and the two ladies who did it were so chatty and reassuring so for someone who has anxiety I felt much more relaxed.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lucky57
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Experiences in hospital
body: I have received very good care throughout the many times I have been in hospital either as an inpatient or just for appointments. The Thorndale Unit is a brilliant department. All the staff are very good and they always keep me very well informed. Sometimes it can be hard to understand some of the doctors. When I have been admitted to hospital, often I am moved around quite a lot and over the last couple of months and there has been a lack of continuity as sometimes doctors say they‚Äôll do things but then don‚Äôt follow through when I then get moved somewhere else. The doctors are all doing their best for the patient though. Every time I have been admitted I have come through A+E but I think it seems like such a cruel way to get people into hospital as they are left on their own for so long and they are often so ill they can‚Äôt communicate properly. Apart from this I have received excellent treatment and consultation since coming to the Thorndale Unit and I have really appreciated being able to have my wife into my appointments with me even during Covid.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Keeen88
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: My experience in A&E and 4 North
body: I have been in the hospital for 2 weeks now. In A& E I had such a long wait and was left alone for roughly 10 hours with no communication from any staff. I felt isolated and in so much pain. Eventually when I was seen the staff were brilliant and were able to provide me with pain relief and make me feel somewhat better. After a while I was then taken up to 4 North where I have been made comfortable and safe ever since. I trust all the staff members up on this ward and feel their communication skills are outstanding. All my questions have been answered and I am grateful to receive the level of care I am getting here.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: bravobg86
title: Great care
body: Medical alert sent in by paramedic prior to arrival. As I was suffering from chest pain and had a previous heart attack. Straight into resus   all staff were fab quick to act and friendly. As a ex nurse myself I could not fault any of their care. Thankfully all was ok and I was able to be discharged next day. Felt in very safe hands all the time I was at Lincoln hospital.

author: scorecardcs95
title: Community midwifery
body: Excellent, professional and reassuring care provided by the team of community midwives from Banbridge, SHSCT. After having second baby and relatively brief stay in hospital the community midwife team are a credit to the Trust, supportive, practical and reasurring staff who instill confidence in the early days of having a new baby. Very grateful for their support, many thanks to Diane in particular.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: orangeep49
title: Getting better after a stroke
body: I'm so thrilled. Posy, Margaret, Rhea, Tracy, Alison, Roanne and Leanne all came to see me and I've come on leaps and bounds. I've felt so happy that they've helped and in the way they have. The love and care that I've had, it's never happened in my lifetime. I will always remember what they did for me. When I speak to my friends I say I wouldn't be here without them. They've all listened to me, it makes me feel I'm going forwards instead of backwards. I didn't have a lot of confidence in myself but now I can't believe what I've done, it's wonderful. It's been hard but I've got there.

author: Macpm98
title: Urology appointment
body: I took my father to appointment as he had issues with his prostrate. We were dealt with by the most patient, pleasant and thoroughly professional Nurse Kathryn. She was so good with my elderly dad who is very deaf as well and showed the utmost patience with him. She explained everything so well making it easy to understand. I feel she deserves recognition for how she deals with patients especially the elderly. She treated my dad, in my opinion like she would her own grandfather and that means a lot to me. I would like her to be made aware of my feedback as she should know how good a job she is doing.

author: severitygw86
title: my experiences over the past year
body:
in March of this year I came to A and E with a dull pain in my stomach. I had it since Christmas and i was feeling breathless when i came in.  
they gave me an x-ray and ct scan thinking i had inflammation of my bowel or diverticulitis- I have never had any problems with my bowels before, so I was red flagged. I was transferred to Craigavon for surgery and I was always at the front of the queue for every treatment - I was very impressed by this. I trusted my doctors decisions completely, I am so thankful to have been treated by such a brilliant surgical team. I recovered welll in hospital.  
In april i received the news that I had cancer, 42 lymph nodes were removed and 1 tested positive for cancer, i was then referred to oncology and had 4 cycles of chemotherapy. I had a stoma bag from my surgery and I started to have problems with it, when I came into Daisy Hill it felt like the doctors didn't know how to treat me.  
i am now doing a lot better since we've found a treatment plan that works, the staff are lovely but can be slow in delivering medications

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Sanky62
title: Bad experience at A & E
body:
Over the past couple of years I have attended Blackpool A+E on several occasions as I have numerous ailments ranging from Policystic Kidney Disease to osteoarthritis in many of my joints(both hips have been replaced. I can only say treatment has been hit & miss. Mostly I have been treated well. I have been dismissed by the department on several occasions only to have to return on a later date to get help I need. Last July I went on with severe stomach pain, loose bowls & loosing blood clots, to be told I just had a bout of 'enteritis' by the nurse & not to be so 'dramatic' & that I couldn't be in that much pain & sent home, only to be admitted again a couple of days later where the staffs attitude was total different, it was found I had an infection in my womb for which I needed antibiotics & was properly cared for.  
Over the past couple of years my osteoarthritis is getting worse, I am constantly in one pain or another,which I can cope with most of the time, though when my joints go into 'spasm' the pain can get unbearable & also triggers my Anxiety(for which I am having CBT treatment to help me cope) My balance is off so regularly stumble, which I did last week resulting in me landing on my knee which caused a shooting pain in my hip when I tried to put weight on it, plus everytime I coughed, sneezed or nodded my head I got pain in my hip. I was taken to A&E where I was treated quite quickly. I was initially offered painkillers, which I did tell them I can't tolerate opiate base painkillers(I had been in hospital just a few weeks before due to a bad reaction to painkillers) Plus due to my Kidney problem I can't take anti-inflameties for which I was given a red/warning wrist band. I was sent for an x-ray which showed my replacement was fine & nothing was broken. (Which I was glad about) they then told me I could go home, (even though I told them I had no one at home & no way to get home) They were totally unconcerned about my other symptoms & just offered me various painkillers which I had already numerous times told them I can't take. By this time my Anxiety levels where excellerating as I felt I wasn't being listened to as the doctor said if I was refusing treatment to go! I was getting extremely upset as I wasn't refusing treatment I just couldn't take what they were offering. I was extremely upset by this time & just wanted to go home. I attempted to leave only to end up on the floor. A nurse did come upto me when I fell on the floor. I was confused & begging for help when another nurse came over & told me to get off the floor or they were getting the police! I was getting extremely upset & begging for help or just to let me go. I felt scared as the nurse was telling me to get off the floor & I was telling them I couldn't but they refused to help me & to 'turn it down'. I eventually got to my feet & left the department having a full blown panic attack not knowing what to do or where I was going. A lady(a member of the public) outside tried to ring me a taxi but couldn't get through. I managed to make my way round to main reception & taxi rank to find that taxis where actually on strike that evening.  
I don't know how long I was wandering around for but I eventually got to the main road where I was spotted by my son's friend who happened to be passing. He picked me up & brought me home. He rang the hospital to find out why I was left wondering around in that state. They told him I had refused treatment & was aggressive, he told them he couldn't believe that as I am not an aggressive person to which they told him they had it all on film & to complain if we want.  
Not only am I still suffering with pain & numbs but also extreme anxiety & no idea how to get help now theses people have flagged me as 'aggressive'

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: Appkl27
title: Attending A and E at UHH  NHSL
body:
I wanted to highlight a very positive experience I had when I attended A and E at University Hospital Hairmyres today. It appeared to be an exceptionally busy period and I was treated very promptly with kindness, respect and efficiency from the minute I booked in at reception. All staff were kind, caring and cheerful including reception staff, porters, radiographers, support staff and nursing staff. A special mention for Dr Raees, medical physician is well deserved for his lovely manner and care. I very much appreciate the care I received and feel reassured that our NHS in Scotland is functioning at such a high level with regards to quality and efficiency particularly during the ongoing pandemic.  
Thank you to all A and E staff for the challenging role you fulfil around the clock.

author: Daisydoo84
title: Poor Mental Health Care
body: As an adult with mental health issues I have to see a psychiatrist on a quarterly basis in order to review my medication and treatment. Unfortunately at a time when the world is in such disarray and this service is needed most, I am still unable to see a psychiatrist face to face. We are now ‚Äòbeyond level zero‚Äô, able to mix in nightclubs etc. And yet basic healthcare is still lacking. At a time where I feel lost, confused and frustrated with things I am being fobbed off with telephone conversations lasting 20 minutes in an attempt to make a decision on my mental health state. I was understanding the first couple of times but now that most things have opened up again, I am flummoxed as to why the mental health out-patients department is still closed due to what they are calling the ongoing Covid crisis. This seems to me like a fobbing off of vulnerable people in a time of need. How can a doctor assess you from a form or phone call better than face to face? No psychotherapy sessions available either, yet I can see a private chiropodist or massage therapist no problem and they are much closer to you. Please tell me when things will be put back to the way they were and patients can be treated like people and not walking contagions.

author: controllerjx58
title: Stithians vaccine centre
body:
My son just returned from stithians show ground  
After having had his vaccine. He wore a mask to be safe but was told to take it off and only wear a small surgical mask which does not cover his beard.  
We all wear masks as a choice to help keep us safe and as it is no longer legal it is our choice s we are disgusted they made him take his off.COVID is high in Cornwall at the moment and I will be making complaints at a higher level.NOT happy.

author: runningqx89
title: Nurses both caring and attentive
body:
Following a burst ulcer, I was transported to Daisy Hill Hospital's Emergency Department via ambulance. There wasn't a long wait and the ambulance staff were all 100% - very good and very caring.  
I was then in the Emergency Department for 5 hours. The staff were all brilliant and I was taken in straight away.  
Following this, I was moved up to the female surgical ward. The ward has been excellent. The staff have also been brilliant, especially all the nurses, they are all very caring and attentive.  
There could be no improvements that would make my stay any better. The care and service has been very good and all staff members have been doing their absolute best.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Lindsay48
title: Support after heart attack
body:
After my heart attack I felt depressed and started to have suicide thoughts. I turned to so many people, there doors were closed. I got talking to a staff member from rehabilitation and after months of getting nowhere, this staff member got Kyle from chest, heart and stroke to contact me & within days of telling them how I felt and Kyle start to get me help from different people even support from a lady who works for a cancer charity. This guy Kyle has stood by me from the first day he contacted me. I feel I'm still in this world today because Kyle supported me.  
I was still having suicidal thoughts because I could not go through life and everyone thinking I was a pest and ignoring me. I still can see no end to things, but iv also got a lady from mental health Ann who is fantastic and between Ann and Kyle I'm hoping they can get me through this as the saying goes; We live in hope and we die in despair.  
Thankyou to the 3 wonderful people who took the time for me because so many people don't understand anxiety and depression and have no time for it. I hope someday I can give something back, thankyou.  
I'm still on the edge of not wanting to be here, but one day at a time, thanks

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Summer21*
title: Day Surgery
body:
I attended Belfast City Hospital for a day procedure. I was anxious about the procedure but all the staff quickly put me at ease. The staff were friendly and welcoming and staff nurse Margaret had such a lovely bedside manner. Special thanks also to Alison, Courtney Jo and Michaela. There were many other members of staff whose names I can't remember but whose friendliness was also very much appreciated. I noticed that staff were busy but always had time for their patients and really seemed to enjoy their work.  
Another amazing team that deserves recognition is the staff from interventional radiology. A special thank you to Carol who kept me calm and informed throughout the procedure.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anonymous-feedback
title: My pregnancy care
body:
I have had an extremely tough pregnancy so far; I am now 27 weeks‚Äô.  
I have previously left a review of the amazing care I have received and continue to receive through the wonderful Wheal Rose ward. I was admitted to the ward again last week due to various problems, mainly a severe migraine that has lasted over 3 weeks. Yet again the care I received from all of the staff on the ward was exemplary. I could not be more grateful to the kind and compassionate staff on this ward who have kept me safe and feeling safe during what continues to be an extremely difficult time. I would be really grateful if the ward can be made aware of my feedback and thanks.  
Further to this, I would like to say a huge thank you to the MRI scan team and sonographers who looked after me during a brain scan last week. In particular the lovey Tom, who‚Äôs warmth and kindness kept me calm throughout my scan. I cannot thank Tom enough and would really appreciate him knowing this. Thank you.

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I had my first face to face new patient appointment today with the health care practitioner who was absolutely delightfull, very welcoming and professional, better than brilliant!
What a wonderful surgery! The doctor had messaged me this morning with my test results and I had only had them done the previous morning. 5 star service.
I will recomend this surgery to my family and friends.
Thank youüôè

title: Reassuring, professional and kind
body:
Outpatient appointment-
I was treated with respect, kindness and care, especially by the Hysteroscopy team. I had worked myself up into a bit of state by the time I was seen and they were so reassuring and kind. They made an unpleasant experience something I walked away from not thinking that, but how well I was looked after.

We are so lucky to have the NHS, and I am very grateful. Thank you.

title: Incredible staff
body: Incredible staff like no other that I have experienced from the NHS. I went for the covid jab on the 24th August with my partner. I was a little nervous given the news around covid vaccinations. Every staff member from greeting us at the door to the aftercare in the waiting room were so compassionate and caring. I really does make a difference for me given that I have a fear of hospitals and gp surgeries. You didn't feel a burden to them for being there. Extremely professional and appeared genuinely  positive and up beat. Thank you to the hardworking team for helping me to see that there are still areas of the NHS who genuinely care and are interested in you.

title: Lovely ,kind staff
body:
They accommodate my appointments to suit my work hrs.This helped me a lot.
Thank you so much to these wonderful people at Runcie wing.

title: Wonderful, kind  receptionists,nurses, doctors
body: My son broke his elbow and went to A and E with him .All staff that looked after my son were very kind and lovely. (receptionists,nurses ,theatre doctors and nurses,starfish ward kind nurses)They showed us compassion and reassured me at all times. Felt safe at all times.Thank you very much for your kindness to all !

title: Great Practice
body: Great staff starting from reception to all consultants, nurses and care assistants. Thank you all for all the support when needed help. Wonderful care

title: First Class
body:
From calling the reception and speaking to a friendly, professional receptionist to triage and then an appointment with the GP I received first class care.
I got an urgent test - within two weeks, a phone call from the GP to report the results a couple of days later and medication sent to a pharmacy away from home. 
Amazing treatment that‚Äôs worthy of five stars. If you compared the service my parents‚Äô receive at their practice in Derbyshire it would be a ten star surgery.
Well done to all the staff and thank you for looking after me and my family, especially over the COVID outbreak.

title: Two days in maternity day assessment
body: My wife and I spent Sunday and Monday for most parts of each day within the maternity day assessment due to some complications with baby, and the service we received from the midwife on duty both days as she was the same person was absolutely incredible, responsive, caring, attention to detail was impeccable. Not only was she extremely busy, whenever she was consulting with ourselves, she never rushed anything, she was calm collected and spot on. What I really appreciate as the husband, was that she took the time to consult with me and explain things to both of us and not just my pregnant wife. The midwife is an absolute asset to WSH, and I hope she inspires many more midwifes to deliver the same quality of care. Thank you very much!

title: Very Caring and Professional
body: I've been with this surgery for 10 years now and have received great treatment and been taken seriously and with real sensitivity at all times. The reception staff are friendly as are the nurses. The follow-up has always been exemplary and I always feel as though I am in safe hands. I was worried when a couple of my favourite GPs left the surgery, but the replacements have been just a great. I'd go as far to say that this practice is the best I have ever been registered with.

title: Great Practise
body: I have been helped so much by Kings Norton Surgery. Over many years they have helped me immensely. My most resent advise and help from the Doctors is truely life saving for me. Menopause has affected me in every part of my life. With all the advise help and expertise of kings Norton Surgery i am now in control and absolutely loving life again. They have gone way beyond any dream i had of feeling well again. I really want to tell my story to help others. Thank you to all the Doctors and team. Im alive loving life fit and healthy again....

title: Radiology
body: I attended for a barium swallow requested by the ENT Department. Everyone I met yesterday was fantastic, from the young man who asked if I needed any help as he walked along the corridor to every single member of staff I met in the radiology department. They were all kind, friendly, helpful, and supportive. The process was explained in detail and I was given plenty of time to ask questions. Not a particularly pleasant procedure, but the staff made the overall experience a great one. Thank you all!

title: Thank you so much for looking after my mum‚Ä¶
body: My mum had a fall yesterday and was taken by free taxi to your MIU, she was seen quickly and well looked after and I‚Äôm extremely grateful as my Dad is currently in Derriford hospital oncology, it‚Äôs a comfort to know there are nurses in the community so mum didn‚Äôt need to go to A&E. Thank you ‚ò∫Ô∏è you‚Äôre so valued.

title: Great Practice
body: I was referred to the First Contact Physiotherapist who was very thorough and went above and beyond to make sure a referral letter was available for collection the very same day!  Very professional and efficient service.

title: Excellent!
body: After completing an econsult I was directed to contact the surgery, the staff member on the telephone was helpful and understanding. Shortly after I was contacted by a practice paramedic who invited me in for a face to face appointment the next day. During my consultation she noticed a swelling in my neck, something completely unrelated to the reason for my appointment! Blood tests were done there and then and a follow up appointment made for 5 days later. At that appointment I saw a practice doctor who confirmed the condition that the paramedic had suspected. He explained the condition and the required treatment in detail. Within 5 days of my initial contact I have had a diagnosis and been prescribed the relevant medication for a condition I had no idea I had! The expertise of the medical staff at the practice has given me answers and peace of mind.  I cannot express enough how grateful I am for the professional, kind, informative and compassionate treatment I‚Äôve experienced at Townhill Surgery. Thank you, what a wonderful team!

title: Great care, and compassion .
body: My 84 year relative, has been having problems, after numerous tests the surgery, quickly referred her, and endless scans at Derriford, later. she is now recovering from key hole surgery. I would like to thank the whole staff at Rosedean, for their vigilance, care, compassion, and being on 'top' of the job, in these difficult times. Thank you

title: A Centre of Excellence
body: I visited the hospital this week with a finger injury and was  so impressed with the kindness and efficiency with which I was treated.  I was greeted at the entrance by a very friendly and smiley nurse, who even remembered me from a call a couple of days earlier.  I was registered, assessed and sent for an x-ray within 15 minutes and, because I am extremely vulnerable and had shielded throughout the pandemic, was given the option to sit away from the main waiting rooms.  I had a short wait for my x-ray and almost immediately afterwards I saw a doctor who diagnosed a broken finger.  The entire process had taken less than an hour and a half!  All the staff I met, nurses, receptionist, radiographer and doctor were incredibly kind, courteous, helpful and efficient.  It really shone out as a centre of excellence within our wonderful NHS.  Thank you to everyone there.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: So supportive
body: When I have needed help, the team at The Limes, Epping have always been there for me. When it‚Äôs urgent, they pull out the stops to do what is needed. I had an appointment yesterday with a senior nurse practitioner. She was kind, patient, supportive and helped me to recognise that changes in lifestyle can drastically change the course of events. I was so grateful for her reassuring me like this because whatever my test results show, I will be able to still feel in control of what happens next. Thank you so much for taking the time with me, it‚Äôs so so so appreciated.

title: Excellent Service
body:
What an Excellent little Practice Hindon Surgery is‚Ä¶
Thank you for all your care and support over the past few weeks. 
I have recently been very unwell and visited Hindon Surgery several times for Dr. appointments, blood tests and an ECG. Despite Covid restrictions your care was outstanding. 
Everyone from the Reception staff, (who always answer the phone promptly) to the Nurses, Phlebotomist, and Dr‚Äôs were overwhelmingly kind and professional. They all displayed a huge amount of empathy, compassion, time and understanding. Nothing was too much trouble. They were also super efficient in organising tests and investigations which is not currently easy during the Pandemic, and the pressures that they are under.  I felt reassured as each and everyone listened to me which is so important. Everyone was so engaging, professional and kind. 
The Pharmacy service is second to none‚Ä¶with prompt and efficient service. I was able to get my asthma inhaler very quickly without having to go to a Pharmacy. 
A happy, professional and cohesive team who obviously work closely together, making you feel that you are the most important person to them at the time. Seeing some one face to face helped enormously. 
All this helped me with my recovery and happy to say that without hesitation I would highly recommend this Surgery to anyone. 
Keep up the good work Hindon Surgery, you are providing an excellent service and it‚Äôs very much appreciated by your patients. 
Thank you so much for everything‚Ä¶.The NHS at its very Best!

title: great receptionist
body: just booked mine and my husbands flu vaccines and i found the receptionist to be extremely helpful and friendly . She went out of her way to accommodate our requests.

title: Great practice
body: Staff polite and always willing to be very helpful to explain my illness and to help me get the medication I need

title: Excellent practice
body:
All the staff especially the reception staff are always helpful friendly and go out of their way to accommodate your needs
The doctors have been brilliant throughout the Pandemic especially during lockdown 
When necessary I have always had a face to face appointment.

title: The extra mile
body:
The surgery was short-staffed at short notice due to norovirus on Monday, such that I wasn't called to advise of a relocation of my appointment from Carpender's Park to Bushey. 

However, on arrival at the Bushey Practice, both the receptionist and the GP - who is most certainly the most empathic gynae expert I have ever come across - turned the whole thing around.

What outstanding service, care, adaptability, empathy and treatment.

5* to this practice again from me.

title: Thank you Doctor!
body: I went to the surgery after getting severe pain in the abdomen area. The doctor was quick and thorough with his examination and provided a exceptional service. He was quick to refer me to A&E; which meant that I could get the treatment required. Because of the doctor's efficiency I was able to receive surgery and the after care was also amazing! Thank you Dr.

title: Exceptional standard of care
body:
Visiting the urgent care department.
 I had a shard of glass in my heel, which had been there for a couple of days and was incredibly painful to walk on. I felt as though this was a silly minor ailment to take t such a busy unit.  
 After booking in, within two hours I had been triaged and had a foot xray. Less than an hour later, I was in a cubicle having everything explained about how the procedure would be in extracting the glass from my foot. Care, communication and good humour ( plus gas and air and a local anaesthetic ) put me at ease. Once completed, I was taken to have another x ray to check all was good. I was also shown the xray of glass in my foot and a wonderful explanation given of why feet are so sensitive.
 Great service. All staff very respectful and good humoured even whilst under pressure. Thanks all.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fabulous service
body:
After joining the practice a month ago I have
received such great service I was dubious about leaving my old practice after being a patient there since I was 2, 58 years ago!! But have nothing but praise for them especially the practice nurse who is fab as are the drs/receptionists. I work in A&E and know the pressure the nhs is under. 
Keep up the good work and thank you

title: Treated on NHS Little Aston - Brilliant
body: I underwent surgery for torn meniscus and needing shaving of arthritis from knee cap.  Everyone was so kind.   I received excellent care from arriving and being met in the car park to bring discharged.  I had to ring afterwards to check on some medication and rang the ward about 8 pm but the nurse spoke to a dr who confirmed it was fine.  I also have to return for physio, again as NHS patient  but definitely receiving same care and professionalism as if I had been private.  The surgeon and anaesthetist were absolutely great.

title: Great practice
body: Helpful and always understanding, easy to talk to, to get appointments. I have always been very satisfied with the dealings with this surgery

title: Good experience
body: I recently had to attend St Peter‚Äôs as an out patient. I was extremely pleased with how I was treated and treatment given. All staff were polite and helpful. The doctor explained everything I was seen on time.

title: Efficient and responsive practice
body:
Best practice I have ever had. Kind and considerate reception staff which is very rare these days.
All services that I have used have been highly efficient with wonderful staff.

title: Lovely surgery
body: I have visited this surgery very often. All the staff are amazing and worked hard for it's patients during the Pandemic. They all deserve a a thank you

title: Great Service
body: I wanted to express my gratitude to the practice for the great service they are providing. No doubt they are feeling the pressure as all GP and frontline NHS providers are in the covid era. However, they continue to remain accessible via online and telephone. I had a medical issue and was offered a telephone and face to face appointment promptly. Thank you to all the staff from reception and admin to HCAs, nurses and GPs (including GP registrars!) for your great care!

title: Superb practise
body: Having just moved to area we were concerned to know which was the best doctors surgery to go with ‚Ä¶ we struck lucky and not only got through on telephone within a minute or two the receptionist explained that the doctor would call us back and that we were no:3 in the system‚Ä¶None of  that  ever happened with our old GPS  in fact we often gave up trying to call anyway doctor did phone and we had an appointment within 20 mins ‚Ä¶ how‚Äôs that for  service  yep 10/10

title: Could not have hand picked a better hospital
body: From going through the doors to coming out was a very relaxing atmosphere. Everything and everybody made you feel relaxed, nurses and consultants were 10 out of 10 would not hesitate to go back. A big thank you to all at Barlborough

title: Fantastic place
body: My name is Robert Bovill, I have just been discharged from Ward 14 after having a Hip replacement. I would just like to say from the surgeon to all the staff from recovery on the ward, my stay was nothing but first class, they went out there way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. There friendly disposition made my stay more bearable, and my thanks and best wishes goes to each and everyone of them.

title: Smoking
body: The staff on the MRI/CT were extremely nice, but coming to hospital for a respiratory illness and having to stand at the entrance, was like standing in a chimney, very smokey, hardly any signs saying no smoking, no enforcement, like going back to the 60's...

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust

title: Appalling - Quite unacceptable
body:
I spent nearly an hour on the phone a month ago to book an appointment. I was only give a phone appointment which was today. The GP did spend about 15 minutes on the phone with me. He then said I needed a blood test followed by a face to face appointment (which is what I tried to book in the first place). He could not make the appointment for me and said I had to go back through the appointment booking process - booking the blood test first and once that is done booking the face to face GP appointment. He agreed with me that could take another 6 weeks - so 10 weeks in total to get a diagnosis. How can that be a satisfactory way to run a practice? 
My wife has had a similar experience. We have now started the process of transferring to a new practice.
Perhaps this is one for the ombudsman
The practice is going against current Government instruction to operate, as before Covid, with face to face appointments when requested.

title: Long waiting time and poor communication
body:
My 7-year daughter had multiple lacerations on her face.
We arrived at the hospital on 21 Aug at around 3:45am and she only got them stitched at around 3:45pm, all of this torture without even being allowed to eat. 
Different doctors told us different things about the anesthetic procedures and their risks during these long hours, and about the delay itself.

In the end, one of the nurses told me that my daughter finally woke up from the anesthetic and was ok, and said "-we are going to bring her to the ward, but only 1 of you is allowed as a companion". I replied saying that my wife and I were very apprehensive and we both wanted to see our daughter and check how she was, but the nurse started to give me a loud moral lesson in the corridor about the 1-companion-only rule and related Covid risks, saying that everyone needs to abide by the rules and preached at me with some personal stories of her etc..
Then after all the moral lessons and rudeness, she finally understood that I wasn't asking for any kind of privilege, I was totally ok with the 1-companion-only rule and didn't want to force having 2 companions, all I asked was to allow both parents to see her (we're parents, we're humans, we have emotions). So we all went down to pick up my daughter and she allowed both of us to see her before she was brought back to the 1-companion-only freaking Ward 19.
I don't know if in the beginning she mistook my request because maybe I was not very clear on what I wanted or something, but what a nightmare nurse, treated us like numbers. She has no empaty or skills for dealing with human-being parents in such a desperate situation like we were, in such a long wait, in a children's ward. She was not alone, there was another nurse/assistant with her who also didn't say a thing to reassure us about our child and silently witnessed the moral lesson we received, it's a shame.

Please call her attention to this and please don't allow a child with lacerations in the face to stay 12 hours waiting for stitches. This is inhuman, we pay taxes, this is not a favour that you are doing to us.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Phone call appointment
body: Rang at 8am and was able to get a phone appointment for the same day.  Missed the nurse practitioners call due to driving (no time slot given but had to go out).  Rang surgery to let them know at 4.30pm and was told I would be phoned before 6pm.  No phone call received.  Could someone from the surgery explain the procedure on missed calls as I know have to ring up again  the following day to try and get an appointment .  You say your lines are busy well it is hardly surprising given the situations .  One appointment is going to take three phone calls to surgery

title: Hugely disappointing
body: I applied to register with the practice in January and it took them 5 months to process my registration. Whenever I try to book an appointment, they either take a ridiculous amount of time to pick up or if they do pick up, they sometimes hang up on you. I find it highly unprofessional and am utterly disappointed. A serious review needs to be done with this practice. URGENTLY.

title: Unreasonable way of making appointments and more‚Ä¶
body:
In this practice most appointments are now by phone (not zoom, so you do not see who you talk to). These appointment consist of 3 hour slots during which the patient is expected to wait for the 10 minute phone call from the GP. I have many work meetings during the day and I simply do not have a 3 hour time slot that I can keep free to wait for a phone call. I find this policy entirely unreasonable. It should be possible even for phone appointments to give an approximate time, with the same risk of a slight delay that I may experience for in-person appointments.
The rationale given was Covid, but this logically does not make much sense. I am sure that it is a convenient way for GPs to arrange their days, but it is simply very disruptive for patients.
The services at this practice have got worse in several additional ways over the last two years or so. Reception staff are unfriendly and most do not know their own systems well so cannot make amendments to contact details, give access to online services etc. Appointment reminders for my daughter have been sent to me (without mentioning her name) repeatedly, leading me to think I had appointments I did not book. My daughter has had to ask 3 times to have her contact details amended.
Prescriptions given following a doctors appointment then require and additional appointment with the pharmacist, who then promptly says I need a doctors appointment to be able to get a prescriptions. I had to phone another two times until someone finally is able to find out from the system that I already had that appointment. 
During in person appointments I have seen people in reception treated so incredibly unfriendly by receptionists, my jaw almost dropped. 
I cannot complain to the practice about this, as complaints just go to the practice manager, who seems to be at the center of this new policy of unhelpfulness and convoluted systems.
I will now look for a new practice in the area, which is difficult as many are oversubscribed.

title: ask my GP service
body: Last 2 times I have tried to use this service it has responded with 'Mile Lane Health Centre is currently unavailable for online requests'. This is despite listening to a lecture on why you should use this service that happens when ringing the practice in the hope of making an appointment.

title: Helpful people
body: Boileau Road Surgery has historically been far behind in terms of being set up for online access and communication.  Through my experience I found out that it is all there but not very well publicised.  I had a problem with the NHS App and being able to download the necessary vaccination certificates to be able to travel back.  It seems that the surgery has had to reconfigure what is known as its Linkage to NHS systems.  It sounded like the problems were at the NHS end so the staff were baffled too.  They really took their time helping me have this sorted

title: Poor Pratice Experience.
body:
Having no choice due to transfers from BullFarm Surgery to Oakwood Surgery in Woodhouse, Mansfield.

I haven't needed to make an appointment or anything, however, needed to ring regarding medication being renewed automatically.

Unfortunately, been spending days each taking half a hour or more in the waiting queue, only to have the phone cut off.

As I have Aspergers, this is extremely frustrating, as something that should take a few minutes, is taking days to solve.

title: Fantastic lead Nurse
body: Yesterday I had an appointment with the lead nurse for routine tests. From the second she opened the door to exit, she was absolutely fantastic. Polite, friendly, efficient and just so patient. She has also given my baby her inoculations a few months ago and was the best. People like her deserve all the recognition possible. Thank you. Danny

title: Surgical Assessment Unit
body: After being seen by the GP in the accident and emergency department I was transferred to the surgical assessment unit. I cannot praise the surgical assessment unit more highly. On the Saturday evening I was met by Linda who I believe is a senior nurse in this department I was given all information on what they were proposing at that time and asked to return the following Monday morning for a review and final decision as to whether surgery was required. On the Monday morning I was met by Rosie one of the nurses who took my blood pressure and other details. I was then seen by the doctor on duty who immediately decided that surgery was required and it was here that I cannot praise the team in SAU enough. I was immediately transferred to a cubicle where they began taking all of my information and preparing me for surgery. After surgery I was returned to the SAU department where the after-care was equally as good as the preoperative care. Special mention must go to Linda the senior nurse on duty on the Saturday evening who came and found me in the  A and E Department. Rosie the nurse who looked after me during the Monday and also last but not least Lynn as she was more than supportive with my post-operative care to ensure that I could return home that same evening. Thank you to all of the team.

title: Telephone and Parking Challenges
body:
My mum has been at the practice for many years and loves the treatment that she has received, however, with the new ways of working and making phone calls it has been a challenged on many occasions to book appointments or obtain medication on her behalf. Several times I have been on hold for over an hour and a half and having to hang up. For a number of days I been trying to amend the fact that the system does not recognise that mum has been double vaccinated - I have emailed through the evidence over a week ago as requested but the system has still not been updated. I contacted NHS today to try and get the Covid letter only to be given reason code 3008 indicating that according to the system she has only had one jab.  She has had two jabs one on 23/1 and the other on the 15/4 -  can this please be sorted.  Between us we have tried contacting the practice several times this week, hanging on for well over an hour, and hanging up and trying again after the hour has passed as requested.  It would be great to see an updated telephone response time - the last one reported was sometime ago.    All I would like is to obtain her Covid Pass so that it is sorted. I appreciate any support that can be provided.

Parking - my mum is very old and needs support getting around - the introduction of the restricted access on the road is becoming a challenge - can you please advise the best way that she can be dropped at the front of the office without obtaining a parking ticket.  

I am still waiting for the phone to be answered 40 minutes and counting
Thank you.

title: Sciatica pain
body: The A&E team were amazing ( once the pass the cue obviously) the nurses  and staff in the intensive care unit are really nice, the mri department were amazing...was all ruined by two surgeons looking at my mri...no empathy no common sense, no nothing. They discharged me as not being urgent being even rude  "you need to be referredby you r gp to a surgeon,  we do not know how long it takes we are not the one taking appointment"  you know what I am a doctor too this kind of behaviour is disgusting so full of themselves ...as I left the nurse on the intensive care unit  looked at me and said " you sure you going to be ok"....no I'm not but been discharged so what can I do ...so depends on who you meet there I guess

title: Unacceptable
body:
Impossible to get anyone on phone.Monday 23 August 2021 tried all morning engaged when I got through at 10.45  after 1 hour 16 mns,number 18 in queue!!!, I was told your gp off today and no more appointments. I called again 12.32 waited 1 hour 32 mns,number 24 in queue !!, I talked to general enquiries about when my gp would be in and advised should be Wednesday. I Called today Wednesday 25 August at 7.58 got through number 4 worse than 2 days ago I waited over an hour to be number 1 in queue then minutes later someone talked to me .
Unbelievable unacceptable unfriendly for older people this service plus for anyone their wrb site promising this and that is not working .

title: Booking procedure is not fit for use
body: The only way to book an appointment is to call at 08:45 which means a large scramble of many people trying to book at the same time. I used 2 separate phones throughout. On the rare occasion I got through and joined the queue, the line went dead before I got to no.1. I appreciate there is strain on NHS practices but this booking system is simply not acceptable for a healthcare provider.

title: Reception
body: Trying to get even in call queue is horrendous.  When you do get through no appointment and doctors not doing face to face . Shame on you donnington practice.  We have to go to work and then when we need a doctor can't get through or even appointment

title: Definitely not a great practice as far as having‚Ä¶
body: This is the third time that having my bloods taken has been cancelled.  The practice manager seems to think I‚Äôll be ok. She has no knowledge of my condition so what gives her the right to say I‚Äôll be ok is beyond me. I‚Äôm 74 and disabled and I detest people who think because they work at a doctors surgery, they know all about medicine. I‚Äôm so disgusted. The staff are lovely, as are the doctors but as for having bloods taken, its ridiculous. I know we are in difficult times at the moment but to keep cancelling just isn‚Äôt on.

title: Dr picks and chooses patients
body: Appointment was at 9:15, Dr comes out and picks the patient he wants to see next even though I have appointment at 9:15 still sitting here 45 minutes later

title: Wonderful care on the ward.
body: Although I cannot fault the care on the ward I was disappointed with the anaesthetic received during surgery. I agreed a little reluctantly to spinal anaesthesia and pointed out that I was very nervous and wanted to be heavily sedated so that I was unaware of what was happening. Although I suffered no pain I was aware for quite a while before I must have been given extra drugs to fully sedate me at which point I was physically shaking. It was a distressing experience for me. If I could turn back time I would insist on a general and if I have to have my other knee replaced or any other surgery I would opt for a general.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Rheumatology Outpatients Appointment
body: I have been waiting for my initial appointment since March 2021.  It has been postponed 3 times and unfortunately the consultant did not telephone for the 4th appointment.  I now cannot get an answer from Outpatients Appointment team and PALS email reply says 10 working days for a reply.  I am finding this stressful.

title: Covid
body: Excellent service but I would have appreciated better ventilation in the waiting area which was an internal corridor with no opening windows. Everything else was excellent and windows were open in the consulting rooms. Generally the temperature was very warm on a not particularly warm August day. Thanks to all the staff working in our wonderful NHS.

title: Amazing practice
body:
I do not recognise the negative comments.  My last visit in particular the doctor was kind and understanding.  I try to never be rude having been on the front line. It is unacceptable for staff to face telephone abuse. My husband and myself are grateful for the care by all, reception, doctors, nurses and 'backroom' staff. 
Thankyou to you all.
